meanings.definition: The act of imposing something harmful or unpleasant on someone.
meanings.sent1: Her inflictions on others always led to trouble.
meanings.sent2: The inflictions of pain caused by the accident were severe.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his cooking was an infliction on taste buds.
meanings.sent4: The inflictions of betrayal can leave lasting scars.
meanings.sent5: The inflictions of punishment were swift and severe.

meanings.definition: The result or consequence of inflicting harm or suffering on someone.
meanings.sent1: The emotional inflictions of the breakup were hard to bear.
meanings.sent2: The physical inflictions of the disease were evident.
meanings.sent3: She found humor in the inflictions of her clumsiness.
meanings.sent4: The inflictions of loss weighed heavily on his heart.
meanings.sent5: The inflictions of war were etched in his memory forever.
